results.title: To designate a mountain in the John Muir Wilderness of the Sierra National Forest as "Sky Point".
results.short_title: To designate a mountain in the John Muir Wilderness of the Sierra National Forest as "Sky Point".
results.committees: Senate Energy and Natural Resources Committee
results.latest_major_action: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 148.
results.summary: (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The expanded summary of the House passed version is repeated here.) (Sec. 2) This bill designates a specified mountain in the John Muir Wilderness of the Sierra National Forest in California as "Sky Point."
results.summary_short: (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The expanded summary of the House passed version is repeated here.) (Sec. 2) This bill designates a specified mountain in the John Muir Wilderness of the Sierra National Forest in California as "Sky Point."

actions.description: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 148.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Murkowski without amendment. With written report No. 115-111.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H709)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 381.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H709-710)
Mr. McClintock moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
